ARABIC: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will be under it for ever. Their punishment will not be lightened. They will be granted no reprieve.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They shall live under it, and none of their agony decrease nor be respite for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Thus shall they abide. Neither shall their chastisement be granted nor shall they be granted any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: with which they will live forever. Their torment will not be relieved and no attention will be paid to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Remaining in it forever; their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they get any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will abide therein. Neither will their torment be lightened nor will it be delayed or postponed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Abiding in it; their chastisement shall not be lightened nor shall they be respited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: therein dwelling forever; the chastisement shall not be lightened for them; no respite shall be given them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They will abide therein. Their doom will not be lightened, neither will they be reprieved;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: In this state they shall abide forever; their punishment shall not be lightened nor shall they be granted respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Abiders therein, their torment shall not be lightened nor shall they be respited.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They will remain in it [forever], and their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be granted any respite,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: In that will they dwell; nor will their penalty be lightened, nor respite be (their lot);-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will abide therein (Hell). Neither will their torment be lightened, nor will it be delayed or postponed (for a while).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: there they shall live for ever. Their punishment shall not be lightened, nor shall they be given respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Remaining in it eternally, without their punishment being eased from them, and without being reprieved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [3:88] Abiding therein, that is, in the curse, or in the Fire implied by it [the curse]; the chastisement shall not be lightened for them and they shall not be reprieved, they shall [not] be given any respite.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They will abide therein) in the curse. (Their doom will not be lightened, neither will they be reprieved) their punishment will not be deferred;
